alert.note: Alert for Concordia (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 8:04PM CST until March 21 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Louisiana... Mississippi River At Natchez affecting Wilkinson, Adams and Concordia Counties. For the Lower Mississippi River ...including Arkansas City, Greenville, Vicksburg, Natchez...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY, MARCH 15 TO TUESDAY, MARCH 21... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Natchez. * WHEN...From Wednesday, March 15 to Tuesday, March 21. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, Carthage Point Road becomes impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Saturday the stage was 43.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Wednesday, March 15 to a crest of 48.5 feet Sunday, March 19. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, March 21. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Mississippi River Natchez 48.0 43.0 Sat 7 pm CST 43.2 43.6 44.2 &&
info.instruction: Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 815 AM CST.
